intro: Chrysopsis jonesii, commonly known as Jones' goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and linear, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Chrysopsis jonesii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral ecosystems.
